title: unesco_heritage_Convent_of_Christ_in_Tomar
text:
Name: Convent of Christ in Tomar. short_description:

Originally designed as a monument symbolizing the Reconquest, the Convent of the Knights Templar of Tomar (transferred in 1344 to the Knights of the Order of Christ) came to symbolize just the opposite during the Manueline period â€“ the opening up of Portugal to other civilizations.
